pop_est_footnotes = | area_land_km2 = 39.20 | area_water_km2 = 1.24 }} Kankakee is a city in Illinois, United States. It is also the county seat of Kankakee County. U.S. House of Representatives member Adam Kinzinger was born in Kankakee. ==History== The Potawatami lived in the area beginning sometime in the 18th century. In 1833 the Potawatami signed a treaty with the United States government. They agreed to leave the region and move west. Kankakee was founded in 1854. ==References== Category:Cities in Illinois Category:County seats in Illinois
title: Kankakee, Illinois
